Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2011 10:28AM beccad wrote: I didn't have the greatest hair texture to start with, ( fine, thin, straight) but I am kinda liking the growth,  It still feels like baby fine, but there seem to be either more or thicker hairs.  I ma not sure what to do about these curls though......sigh.  Hoping it will be longer soon so that I can try a straightnening iron at least part of the time.  Beccad

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 11:50PM beccad wrote: Marjie, I too think we have about the same growth. I did lose my brows and lashes, the brows started coming back in almost immediately, the lashes are still a little sparse, but I have given up on eyeliner. By the end of the day I would look like a racoon when I wore it. Miss Clairol and I have had a couple of afternoon meetings over the last 3 or 4 months and it is about time again. I am not liking the new darker color that I seem to have along with the gray sideburn thing that seems to be going on here. I was one of the October chemo ladies, so I have been done with chemo for 7 months on the 7th of September. Becca

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 02:58PM beccad wrote: Carrol, check out the "One'n'Only Argan Oil" line at Sally Beauty Supply. The shampoo conditioner and styling cream do not have parabens or phatlates in them. I have been using then for about 4 months now. I keep waiting for my hair to return to its normal self, then I will have to find a new shampoo for oily hair that does not have the parabens. The argan Oil products are labeled as moisturizing.

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 07:09AM beccad wrote: Thanks for the replies.  Yes, Roseann, I am a reader.  Sometimes I think I try to read too much and the I scare the $%^& out of myself.  My oncologist advised me to not try to read so much about my TN dx, but then added that she knew just from meeting me that it was probably not possible.  I will try to find those books, and read them however. Oh, I did see the bone scans images and I did not see any bone involvement,  ( not an official report, just a Nuclear Medicine Tech. seeing her own images!)  The tech who did my injection was a very sweet girl who may end up working for me on a part=time basis, and the tech who did my scan, was also very kind and caring.  I did not know what to expect from them since they are  at a huge facility in our area.  The thech at the PET Imaging place I felt was not as compassionate. That may just me and my expectations,though.  Oh, btw, at our weekly sit and stitch last night, I was suprised with an impromptu B-day party, and a friend who's DD has 1 year out post surgery, and chemo, brought wigs, hat, scarves and othe goodies for me to try before spending lots of $$$ on those items.  Plus lots of hugs and emergency chocolate was brought to me.  Now I need to hope that chocolate is not something that will not taste right to me when chemo starts next week.   Becky
Posts.Title: New Here beccad Dara_Diverse

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2011 08:50PM beccad wrote: hello ladies,  I just found your March 2011 Mast. thread.  I had my BMX w/ TEs on monday 3//7 stayed overnight and came home on Tuesday about noon.  I have 4 drains in and am hoping that 2 will be coming out this next monday.  I have not had too much pain, or maybe I am taking plenty og hydrocodone.  I have cut back to tylenol during the day.  This next 4 weeks off of work is sounding like I am going to have lots of Dr. appts.  Next Monday I see the PS's nurse to have drains checked and possibly 2 or 3 removed, tuesday I see the BS to get path results, Thursday I see the PS to start fills, and then I need to see the MO, and meet the RO the next week.  I had neoadjuvant chemo, and may need more chemo depending on the path report, and I know I will be having rads after my fills, but before recon. Beccas
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 04:43PM beccad wrote: My PS had me get " a comfortable bra" (ha ha) in the cup size that I wanted to end up being.  This was last week after my first fill.  I was also told to use wash cloths or clean (no kidding) socks to fill it out for now.  I did get 2 front hook bras in a C cup size, but can't make them look right with socks ot wash cloths, so I went to WalMart and got the front hook sports bras and am wearing them mmost of the time for now.   The last 2 drains were removed Tuesday, and I had my 2nd fill about an hour ago.  I do feel a litte tighter in the chest area now.  The PS also removed about 60 cc's of fliud off of the lower part of the left side.  That was the BC side and has had some swelling since surgery on 3/7.  even with drains in the PS removed about 100cc's last week before the fills.  I will probably have 2-3 more fills before rads begin.  I will meet the RO along with following up with my MO on Monday.
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: beccad wrote: OK, ladies, and I assume a few gents also.  I am joining the club, under protest.  I  am a nuclear medicine technologist.    Just diagnosed this month.  Things are moving pretty quickly, part of this is from being in the medical field, however, I feel that too many people who wouldn't know my dx otherwise are having to be told.  For example Dr's at my hospital who are not part of my care team, who want their patients to have routine scans on days that I have an appt. somewhere.  I am the only full-time Nuc Tech at my facility.    Here is my time line so far:  Oct. 1: go to family Dr.complain of swollen lymph node under lt arm.  She suggests diag mammo. Oct 5: mammo, sono, (go back and scan 2 more patients), Core Bx. Oct 8: preliminary path report,  Invasive poorly differentiated ductal Ca, with lymph node involvement. Oct 13.  Meet with Breast surgeon,she recommends chemo, mastectomy, more chemo, with radiation. Final path report later that day, triple negative,  Oct 19: Meet with Oncologist,did lab work, we will get port inserted, and start TAC. Oct 20: (today) PET scan. Oct 21: Meet w/ general surgeon to discuss port.  ( I talked to her at work the A.M.)  Oct 22: ECHO, bone scan, bone survey, EKG  Oct 24:  HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!! Oct 26: Port Insertion Oct 27: Start Chemo. Not looking forward to this, but want it GONE.  After seeing the Oncologist I am feeling better and thinking that we may be moving ahead.  I think this may sound like it is moving fast, but I can't imagine not knowing who to turn to or to put on my team.   Any suggestions of what I can do to move this any faster? Becky  Dx 10/8/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, 6/11 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New Here beccad Dara_Diverse

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 05:41PM beccad wrote: Thanks to all of you, I really feel that I have a good group of friends here and you my new computer sisters ,too, but you ladies may get tired of me before this is done, (Is it ever done?).  I do know that I will have questions, and comments, and probably have to come here and vent some. Becky

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2011 12:59PM beccad wrote: Yes drains are a real pain.  My BS did take out my last 2 drains at 2 weeks.  One of those was still putting out over 75 ml per day, but she does not like to leave drains in over 2 weeks due to increased chance of infection.  Later that week I saw the PS and he did aspirate some fluid before my TE fill.   Oh, BTW I had my last fill yesterday.  I will see the RO on Monday for CT scan prior to marking for rads.
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 08:22PM beccad wrote: I had one drain that was still at over 75 ml per day and the BS still took it out at 2 weeks, too much risk for infection.  The PS did a needle aspiration 2 days later of over 60 ml, but I have had no problems.  I did finish my fills last Thursday and it looks like I will start Rads next week.   BTW, I did start back to work this week, after 4 weeks off to recover from the BMX w/TEs.  Only working half days this week but it looks like longer days next week depending on what time rads will be scheduled. Beccad.

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2012 11:06AM beccad wrote: I don't know if I have ever posted on this forum, or just lurked, but I had my recon on 12/6 and will be having "dermal pigmentation" nipple tattoos tomorrow.  I don't think that I have completely rolled onto my stomach to sleep yet, but I have woke up in an allmost stomach sleeping position.  I may have to try a microbead pillow, I think I have a small one around somewhere that travelled in the car after the bilat mastectomy in March.
